Questions.title: printing in python
Questions.question: in c++ you would use "cout <<". in python you would use?

Questions.title: user input in python
Questions.question: in c++ you would use "cin >>". in python you would use?
Questions.explanation:
We use "input()" to get user input in python.
You can insert a string as arguement which will be shown as a prompt: "input("Enter input:")".

Questions.title: Functions  in python
Questions.question: in c++ you would use "return_type function_name( parameter list ){body of the function}". in python you would use?
Questions.right answer:
def function_name ( parameter list ):
body of the function
wrong answers:
def function_name ( parameter list ):
{body of the function}

def function_name ( parameter list )
{body of the function}

function_name ( parameter list )
{body of the function}
Questions.explanation: in phyton we use the def keyword and it doesnt have return_type
